Articles.Content:
Well hello, I'm "new" at the game because I got it only about a couple weeks ago, but I'm not because I know quite a bit of the game. I think what I'm new to is the website. This is only like my 4th or 5th time ever coming to this website and actually looked around. Since I'm new (not, maybe, kinda), is there any advice I should have as to the website? Any good old fashioned tips as to getting along with the people here? Or just how not to be a guy that's like "WAT I DO?!"? That would be splendid.

Thanks.
Well. Be nice,don't put K in words and don't use adult language.

Hey Noname115. They used to tell us in the army "when in doubt, pull it out" and "sound off like you got a pair!". You probably don't wanna listen to me. You'll be the first to get banned before 5 posts.(just kidding). Welcome aboard! There's no such thing as a bad question. I tried to read through the stickies as much as I could before posting. Most of the info you need to know about what not to bring up and how to use the forums is in there. Good luck!

Well NoName115, I'd suggest welcoming new users if you want to get your post count up. You should checkout the challenges topic if you're looking for some real fun: I once made a probe that could get from Low Kerbin Orbit to Laythe, back again, and back to Laythe. It weighed less than 7 tons, and was only designed for a one-way trip and deorbit. Best of all, it included a rover, 2 weather stations, and a base. The fuselage was made out of xenon tanks. Starter tip: DON'T estimate dV numbers on pen and paper. That's how I got 4 times the dV I wanted.
